Title: Children and HIV infection
Source: The Curated Reference Collection in Neuroscience and Biobehavioral Psychology
Abstract: © 2016 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.This chapter explores some of the wideranging effects of HIV on t he lives of children. This includes children who have HIV infection themselves and then the broader group of children affected by HIV either through in utero exposure, family or community exposure. The chapter explores issues around psychosocial wellbeing in the presence of antiretroviral treatment. Such treatment has dramatically changed the prognosis for children as well as the prognosis for their parents and family. The epidemic has thus evolved, but the residual lifelong impact of family clustering of HIV, bereavement, stigma, child development, treatment and care needs are all a complex challenge.
